intro: Hydrangea villosa, commonly known as the silky hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to eastern North America. It is characterized by its dense, grayish-white foliage and clusters of white or pink flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils and partial to full shade. Its leaves are typically ovate to elliptical in shape and covered in fine, silky hairs. Hydrangea villosa is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to provide seasonal interest in gardens.
